meanings: victory, a successful war, triumph, ―하다 win a war[battle]
a victorious army, a conquering army.

vlive.english: Dance my solo dance in "Victory Song"?

examples.korean: Nothing but a battle lost can be so melancholy as battle won. 발음듣기 패전같이 비참한 것은 없지만 승전 또한 비참하다. (서양속담, 전쟁속담) 명언/속담
examples.english: Nothing but a battle lost can be so melancholy as battle won. 발음

examples.korean: After losing the war, the country ceded land to the conqueror. 발음듣기 전쟁에 패한 후 그 나라는 승전국에 영토를 내주었다. Neungyule
examples.english: After losing the war, the country ceded land to the conqueror. 발음

examples.korean: The victorious country dictated the terms of peace to the defeated country. 발음듣기 승전국은 패전국에게 강화 조건을 지령했다. Friendict Level English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The victorious country dictated the terms of peace to the defeated country. 발음

examples.korean: These members are the victorious nations of World War II: China, France, Russia, Great Britain, and the United States. 발음듣기 이 국가들은 2차 세계 대전의 승전국인 중국, 프랑스, 러시아, 영국, 미국이다. Neungyule
examples.english: These members are the victorious nations of World War II: China, France, Russia, Great Britain, and the United States. 발음

examples.korean: Ghana victoriously celebrated defeat over Guinea in the opening match of the Africa Cup tournament. 발음듣기 가나는 아프리카 네이션스 컵 토너먼트의 개막 경기에서 기니를 물리친 것에 대해, 승전 축하를 했다. Neungyule
examples.english: Ghana victoriously celebrated defeat over Guinea in the opening match of the Africa Cup tournament. 발음
